r
Bodley from my L.

ture, yet forasmuchas some thing hath passed

r

ch
is fytt for yo
w

th

tie

t

vyce
of his
great preparac
o
n of shipping only intended for to
possess
Brest
Haven where he hath
o
e on syde of
e haven
already buylt
himselfe
a fort wherin he spareth no charge to procede and
fynding that w
th
out a great Force his deseigne cannot
be altred, and that force
is
to be
used
both by sea and land,
shee
wherupp
o
hir Ma
ty
sent expressely

r
Roger Williams
to
e
F
r
K.
after his returne
lately made
from Brest, to acquaint him w
th
the state of that place, and to let him knowe

that her may
tie
perceaving
e immynent danger by
e losse
of that haven, and forseing howe litle advantage any
other place in Brytt
ny
wylbe if that be lost,
to
dyd
make
him
to
e K. this proposic
o
n, that if he would
resolve to send downe such an Armye by land of horse
and foote as being increased w
th
suche forces as she
could convenyently spare, might be able to master
e
e
n
emy in the
feild and lykelye to recover that fort, w
th
out
e w
ch
small frute wyll aryse of
any
e
acc
o
n taken in hand,
that then shee would send a convenient
porc
o
n of

i

p

n. To
all
this

hath
made answere that

e
D. Montpensier
w
th
2000 foote
and 1000 horse out of
Normandy
w
th
the addic
o
n
of those forces w
ch

ch
aryse in his account to [iij
ee
] or [iiij
ee

men
more,
w
t
and some 600 horss.
Of
all w
ch
nombers althoughe her may
tie
sees
no reasone, to believe that any great thing can
be done, yet is shee resolved to enter into some cowrse
howe to obvyat this vyolent purpose, and nowe
resorting to
expecting
e
fourmance
remembrance
of
many
offers made by
e

tie
for the

vice in brita
y

n even as by many l

ty

ticulerly dealt w
th

r

there agent even by her owne mouthe, speedely

o

r

ch

I have moved

r

ty

t
upp
o

r

ation

e

ty
is pleased
t
you do

ceave some answ
r

tis
po-
sitions and after signify yo
r
ceeding,
in all things
without

ts

knowen.
Yo
w
are to deale w
th
e states, that what nombers of
shippinge and men, and w
th
what quantitie of
munytion they wyll assist this service of Brittayne
the same may w
th
out delay be put in execuc
o
n.
For her May
tie
hathe already sent
to
S
r
John Norreis
w
th
all his power already by land to Brest and hath
also sent certen her shippes of warr to discover
e
state of Brest haven. and therfore if
e states
shall seriously mynd
e good of this service
by there ayd, the same wyll do no good if it
should be delayed.
